content.raw:
I managed to reproduce it on my desktop. Found a way to always reproduce:

1. Insert a walls

1. Insert a window on that wall

1. Drag the window out of the wall and alone in space

1. Save and exit - crash.

Now that I know how to reproduce I'll try to debug a bit more. In any case, here's the backtrace:

~~~
Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()
(gdb) bt
#0  0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()

    __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazebo/gazebo/gui/building/RectItem.cc:104
#2  0x00007ffff7a17fb9 in gazebo::gui::WindowItem::~WindowItem (this=
    0x5092330, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazebo/gazebo/gui/building/WindowItem.cc:76
#3  0x00007ffff304a2c6 in QGraphicsScene::clear() ()
   from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQtGui.so.4
#4  0x00007ffff79fa8ca in gazebo::gui::EditorView::OnDiscardModel (this=
    0x318edf0)
    at /home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazebo/gazebo/gui/building/EditorView.cc:1012

    at /home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazebo/gazebo/gui/building/BuildingMaker.cc:1626
#9  0x00007ffff79cee0a in operator() (this=<optimized out>)
    at /usr/include/boost/function/function_template.hpp:767

content.html:
I managed to reproduce it on my desktop. Found a way to always reproduce:

  1. Insert a walls

  2. Insert a window on that wall

  3. Drag the window out of the wall and alone in space

  4. Save and exit - crash.

Now that I know how to reproduce I'll try to debug a bit more. In any case, here's the backtrace:
